abstract: Goldman Sachs on Thursday named 272 executives who will become managing directors next year, rising to the second-highest ranking within the firm and entitling them to a bigger share of its profits, according to an internal memorandum obtained by DealBook.

lead_paragraph: Goldman Sachs on Thursday named 272 executives who will become managing directors next year, rising to the second-highest ranking within the firm and entitling them to a bigger share of its profits, according to an internal memorandum obtained by DealBook. (Read the text of the memo at the end of this article.)

byline.original: By Michael J. de la Merced
